description:
Hello,

I have an Augie laptop in my office for my student workers to use. We have been trying to get a PDF to print from the laptop to OldMainMFP or OldMain1stFloor and neither works. This has not been a problem in the past, and we did restart the laptop to let it deal with some updates before trying again, but we were still unsuccessful. Any help would be appreciated.


Thanks!
description_no_html: Hello, I have an Augie laptop in my office for my student workers to use. We have been trying to get a PDF to print from the laptop to OldMainMFP or OldMain1stFloor and neither works. This has not been a problem in the past, and we did restart the laptop to let it deal with some updates before trying again, but we were still unsuccessful. Any help would be appreciated.    Thanks!
name: Laptop/Printer

Hello


I can't seem to login to the computer here.  It says no login servers are available.  Can you please fix this?


Joshua

description: Trouble reported with OldMainGroundFloor and OldMain2ndFloor printers - user computers report an "error state" and/or printer displays show that printer is trying and retrying to connect to server without success. Seems like a network issue, but please advise if it needs to be reported to OMC instead. Thank you!
description_no_html: Trouble reported with OldMainGroundFloor and OldMain2ndFloor printers - user computers report an "error state" and/or printer displays show that printer is trying and retrying to connect to server without success. Seems like a network issue, but please advise if it needs to be reported to OMC instead. Thank you!
name: Server not connecting to printers
resolution_description: A network switch was down in Old Main, all network connectivity has been restored.

description:
Old Main Ground floor printer wasn't working. Nirmala and I tried to talk through the issue, but ran out of time. I then looked at the print queue and saw there were some print jobs for Nirmala and Emil Kramer in the queue.

Shawn took a look at it and it doesn't seem to be responding on the network.
description_no_html: Old Main Ground floor printer wasn't working. Nirmala and I tried to talk through the issue, but ran out of time. I then looked at the print queue and saw there were some print jobs for Nirmala and Emil Kramer in the queue. Shawn took a look at it and it doesn't seem to be responding on the network.
name: Old Main Ground Floor printer not w
resolution_description: Port issue due to a problematic switch. Sean M. was repairing when I got there. Printer is now back on network.

description:
The DVD doesn't play correctly.  No visual, but there is sound - which is very staticky.  Played the DVD through the computer and the sound is still very staticky, so it is not the DVD player...well it still has problems

Also, there is an "ink" plug-in for power point that keeps professors from using their power points and then I have to go down and end task on it to get power point to work.  Is there a way to keep it from automatically opening and attaching itself?

From: Huntsha, Lisa <lisahuntsha@augustana.edu>
Date: Tue, Mar 5, 2019 at 3:46 PM
Subject: Fwd: Delivery Status Notification (Failure)
To: Helpdesk, ITS <helpdesk@augustana.edu>




Hi ITS,


I tried to send an email to students from our swensoncenter@augustana.edu email account this morning (I ended up forwarding it to them from my personal account), but I was wondering why we weren't able to send it from this account? Is this something that can be changed for the future?


Error message below.


Thanks!


Lisa

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"



[image: semla.jpg]




*Come Build-a-Bun!*



*Today, March 5, 2:00 - 4:00 pm *(or as supplies last)



Swenson Center (1st floor Denkmann)





It's Fat Tuesday and in Sweden that means eating *semlor *(Swedish
lesson: one *semla*, two *semlor*)! *Semlor *are almond-filled cardamom
buns topped with whipped cream.





Legend states that in 1771, Swedish King Adolf Frederick died after eating
14 servings of *semlor*. Let's indulge with just one or two this
*fettisdag *(Fat Tuesday).




Grab one on your way to class!




<http://www.augustana.edu/swenson>
<http://www.facebook.com/SwensonCenter>



--000000000000251ac905835a4c95

description:
We need to make the semester courses live for the catalog and make the trimester courses no longer show.  Below is a the syntax to make the new courses and some of the other courses that did not get the new date of '06/01/19' to also show, since we kept some courses active if nothing was changing about them.  Justin, could you update the website to use the revised syntax?  Please let me know if you have any questions, also if you could also let Liesl and myself know when this is done.  


--CREATE COURSE_CATALOG TABLE IN WEBPUBLISHING USING THE FOLLOWING STORED PROCEDURE.  SCHEDULE TO UPDATE NIGHTLY.--


SELECT CRS.COURSES_ID,
CRS_TITLE, 
CRS_NAME,
REPLACE(CAST(CRS_DESC AS VARCHAR(1500)),CHAR(253),' ') AS CRS_DESC, 
CRS_MIN_CRED, 
CRS_MAX_CRED, 
PREREQ.ACR_PRINTED_SPEC AS PREREQS 
FROM COURSES AS CRS
LEFT JOIN (SELECT POS, COURSES_ID, CRS_STATUS FROM APPROVAL_STATUS
           WHERE POS = '1') AS STAT ON CRS.COURSES_ID = STAT.COURSES_ID
LEFT JOIN ACAD_REQMTS AS PREREQ ON CRS.CRS_PREREQS = PREREQ.ACAD_REQMTS_ID

LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM COURSE_CONTACT
          WHERE POS = '1')  AS CC ON CRS.COURSES_ID = CC.COURSES_ID 

LEFT JOIN (SELECT * FROM COURSES_LS 
          WHERE CRS_COURSE_TYPES = 'PEA') AS CSTYPE ON CRS.COURSES_ID = CSTYPE.COURSES_ID 


 WHERE (CRS_START_DATE = '06/01/19' OR CC.CRS_INSTR_METHODS IN ('INL','DIR','IND') OR 
 (CRS_NAME LIKE 'MULS-%' OR CRS_NAME LIKE 'MUCH-%' OR CRS_NAME LIKE 'MUEN-%') 
 OR CRS_COURSE_TYPES = 'PEA') AND CRS_END_DATE IS NULL
ORDER BY CRS_NAME
